name: We Come From The Same Place

metadata.name: Mariupol
metadata.description:
I visited the border with Poland and Ukraine this month to document the ongoing refugee crisis as a result of the Russian invasion in Ukraine. 

More than 3 million people have fled Ukraine to neighboring countries due to the war happening right now, most of whom are mothers doing everything it takes to keep their families safe.

Between assignments I made this portrait series of people boarding trains and buses from Przemy≈õl, Poland, on their way to other destinations around the country and Europe. 

The images are named after the Ukrainian cities that have been hit the hardest since the war began. 

50% of the proceeds of this series will go to the International Committee of the Red Cross, currently providing aid to the mothers and children fleeing the country.
